poll_list.title: Collateral Onboarding Project-based Funding Request (PFR) - August 22, 2022

content.content: Background The purpose of the Project-based Funding Request (PFR) is to gain support from the community as to the use of the existing Collateral Engineering Services (CES) core unit budget for professional services related to collateral onboarding and management. During the collateral onboarding process, the collateral stakeholders and domain teams need access to professional services for the assessment, implementation, and management of collateral applications relating to risk, legal, business terms, credit, and other attributes. Given the current situation with Real World Assets (RWA) and to eliminate any confusion with the SPFs, I am asking the community to support the utilization of the current CES budget for RWA professional services. CES will manage the administration and implementation of the reallocated funds.  Request Purpose of Funding: RWA professional services for collateral applications as listed on the CSI. Funding Approval: 44,000 Dai or 45% of the Professional Services CES budget line item 56,000 Dai or 40% of the Contingency Buffer CES budget line item 100,000 Dai is an allocation only. Professional services for RWAs can have large variances and a buffer prevents delays in the implementation of any one collateral. It also provides a cap so that the community is involved with any additional expenses that go over this amount. If additional funds are requested, CES will share summary data and the community will make a decision on continued professional services funding for RWAs whether from the existing CES budget or as a SPF. Scope of Work:  Fulfill the onboarding and management requirements of RWAs Utilize contractors/third parties to advise the domain teams in the areas of risk, legal, business terms, credit, etc. for the purposes of implementing RWAs Educate the community (Discord, forums, meetings) on the details of the RWA implementations If necessary, engage third parties to provide assessments relating to risk, terms, credit, or other areas deemed necessary by the domain teams Hire contractors to perform professional services on behalf of the CES core unit and domain teams  Fund Management:  All work will be managed by invoices from contracted services Once the work is complete, a full accounting of the costs will be made publicly available   Process   Tuesday, Aug 16: PFR forum post  Friday, Aug 19: Updated: Clarify the use of existing CES budgeted funds for RWA professional services  Monday, Aug 22: Governance Poll to approve the PFR  Thursday, Aug 25: Poll ends, CES budgeted funds supported/not supported

POC, this is an alternative to the SPF posted here: MIP55c3-SP7: Legal Work on MIP65 Special Purpose Fund The community can decide on which approach they feel is appropriate to move forward. Either the PFR or SPF should be approved, not both.

Thanks for clarifying, was getting confused as to why there were two requests for the same thing. I think the project based approach makes sense for this MIP if this is the only pending workstream (set of tasks) in the project which it might not be. Are there other workstreams that would require additional funding to complete this MIP, would it be better for the CUs and community if there was one PFR that covered the MIP from now until execution? The MIP has been approved so splitting out the additional funding into smaller pieces does not make sense. In either case, happy to see that there is interest from multiple CUs on moving this MIP forward.

During the collateral stakeholder meetings on Monday, we discuss the implementation details for all collaterals that we’re working on. The big gap with MIP65 is MakerDAO legal support. If there is additional work and we need to engage external third parties for opinions/assessments, the collateral applicant has agreed to pay for those services. The implementation teams may have questions and therefore we may pay for third party advice but that should be covered under this amount. I do not anticipate additional PFRs for MIP65. Regarding the process, for RWAs that are Greenlit, the goal would be to have one PFR per application then allow the community to decide whether to fund it. If not, we stop work and move on. We want to have budget for professional services so we’re not going back to the DAO to do Dai transfers for each RWA. We would still continue with the PFR request/gov poll for each RWA since the professional services investment might not be worth it and this would allow the community to decide based upon the data we provide. It’s important to think of this work as an investment. We also want to ensure that any RWA costs are allocated back to the appropriate parties. It’s common for collateral applicants to pay for a majority of the professional services costs. We also need to evaluate implementation costs for development and ensure those are paid by the appropriate parties. This is part of the evolution of the collateral onboarding process.

I don’t understand this post.      monkey.irish:  the community has the ability to make a decision in less than two weeks   It is not clear if this is a new MIP or if this is an implementation of some MIP that doesn’t exist yet. Based on the title, it seems it would be defined in the MIP65, but it is not? We cannot post something to circumvent the Governance Process and make a decision in less than the pre-established times because that would open the door for all sorts of attacks (quick, let’s decide to empty the surplus buffer in the next 2 hours!). We can use the current tools (or modify them) to improve governance and be more agile (it’s probably much needed). But it needs to go through the governance cycle and be ratified by the MKR holders.     monkey.irish:  In working with GovAlpha   Maybe someone from @GovAlpha-Core-Unit can clarify, please?

juan:  Maybe someone from @GovAlpha-Core-Unit can clarify, please?   [One of] Your friendly Governance Facilitators, reporting for duty  So @monkey.irish is making use of his facilitator powers to insert a domain related request into the weekly polling cycle. We recommended that if this is a recurring issue/plan it really should be part of the MIPs process. However, in this case Robert is saying the legal uncertainty around RWF is causing delays and he proposing some limited scope financing to fix that problem. It will be up to the MKR holders if they support this approach or would like to see it more rigorously defined. As a Governance Facilitator I need to defer to elected experts to recommend urgent changes when they are needed. In the same way that StarkNet is able to insert a poll about their launch parameters, Robert should be able to insert one on maintaining the collateral services. Feedback from the community is encouraged here as we do have time before this is polled if a better solution to the stated problem can surface.
Ah, gotcha. Can we change the title to this, then?     prose11:  insert a domain related request into the weekly polling cycle
Seems like that’s perhaps more accurate but this is your post @monkey.irish

prose11:  but this is your post   If @monkey.irish wants to use his special powers as a domain expert, he should be able to, but we should call things what they are. Governance needs to understand that he’s pushing the urgency button on this topic to get the funding quickly and not bypassing governance (I had forgotten about these powers, so it might be fair to assume that not every MKR holder knows the process perfectly. Just my two Dai.

Would it be better to merge both requests PFR and SPF into a single request? A poll that included PFR, SPF, abstain and no as possible options. I am not able to perform a reasonable comparison based on the descriptions to understand which working arrangement would be more suitable. It just seems that both are requesting 30k for legal work to progress MIP65. Since its just one workstream that is requested, I am failing to understand the differences between PFR or SPF approaches.

Yes, all in the details of our governance…     manual.makerdao.com    Governance Flow      Yes, I am pushing the urgency button in the name of business continuity as well as trying to manage the collateral onboarding process holistically. We have a very specific implementation process for collateral onboarding. The domain teams see the gaps very quickly and we want to respond asap so that we don’t block anything moving through the system.
Are there any other collateral types that CES sees in danger and should be unblocked?

There are several Greenlit collateral that we’ll need clarity: Backed Finance (current SPF for legal), Egyptian ATDC (unknown), Robinland (unknown). There has been some pushback on Backed Finance on the SPF and using a PFR might resolve some of those concerns. Since Egyptian ATDC is Greenlit, we need to determine if we are going to fund professional services (legal, risk, deal, credit, etc.) or not. This is on hold until we figure it out. For Robinland, we just need to figure out if this deal is moving forward. It is been on the CSI for some time without an RWF update. For RWA collateral applications in the Greenlight poll (BlockTower, Detox Digital Coin, Cabot), if any of those pass, we’ll also need professional services for those as well.

The PFR approach is being used since as a Core Unit Facilitator, I am looking to solve a problem in my domain space both today and in the near term. My goals are:  Ensure quick decisions (<2 weeks) on professional service spending when dealing with RWAs Involve the community by asking for ongoing support of a collateral using a Governance Poll, go/no-go Assist with the relative priorities of collateral on the CSI  After running these experiments, build the PFR step into the collateral onboarding process Create a budget for professional services so that the collateral stakeholders don’t need to do transfers from MakerDAO to fund the professional services. The PFR would be a go/no-go step from the community on if we want to spend the money already budgeted.  When working with GovAlpha, we agreed PFRs request/Dai transfer would be temporary until we can develop a more permanent solution. I’ve included what I am hoping that will look like in the future. The MIP65 SPF is a very specific request for a legal deliverable, which is needed. What we have found is that every RWA implementation has numerous questions and therefore, we need advice from qualified third parties to ensure we do the proper implementation. Many times, it’s outside of a legal scope. The general SPF MIP process isn’t designed to do what I am proposing in my goals. It’s not an issue with the SPF MIP. It’s just that we need something different that doesn’t exist yet and we have an immediate need.

Is the main thing that needs to be funded via this request legal services to keep @christiancdpetersen in the loop? Know you have a lot on your plate now, but would like to know if you are supportive of this proposal as something that would mitigate the problems outlined here: Embedding legal analysis on new governance proposals

@monkey.irish @juan For the sake of clarity and context. I support the initiative initiated by Robert here with regards to creating a shared funding mechanism for funding work of professional services e.g. legal review initiatives. I had this in the backlog and discussed with @wouter a number of times. It shouldn’t be new to SES. This is just an initial proposal for one collateral onboarding. But it is part of a wider initiative to move towards a narrowly scoped fund for legal work related to onboardings. The intention is that the scope of fund use is much narrower than SPF, around legal services for onboardings. But also its operation is much more efficient than the SPF. RWF has a line item related to legal professional services that has been one of the most contentious, and seriously, a headache more than anything else. With the creation of a shared operational fund we will be able to significantly reduce the dssVest for RWF around services for legal. That shared operational fund still needs to provide operational processes for how it will/should work as well as scope and which obligations apply to fund requesters and fund releasers. The setup of such processes, scope etc can be done via a MIP. More than happy to collaborate with @monkey.irish and @wouter/@juan/@prose11 on that. But all in all, the request from Robert is a step in that direction to create more efficiency in getting access to funding for legal services related to onboardings. Once the fund is operational, RWF can then reduce its legal line item footprint. I think everyone will gain from this.

I am supportive and I am pleased to assist CES with on-going HVB matters and, in respect of MIP65, supporting the joint efforts of Strategic Finance and CES. Any work billed for MIP65 will be to either Strategic Finance or CES - not both.

On the questions of urgency, now that I better understand there was a specific ask by Rune to get funds spent to move MIP65 forward… what about all the other counterparties and collateral needing attention and why is this one prioritized with this request ?

POC, Rune did not ask me to do anything here. It was based upon what I perceived to be needed for business continuity. This post came as a result of working with the domain teams, including RWF, and presenting it as a holistic option to ensure work would not be blocked. The options are to do these one at a time or ask for a lump sum from the DAO. My gut tells me the lump sum approach will bring up all sort of tangental discussions that I do not want to be involved with at this moment. And I still would want to allow the community to be involved with, should we spent X Dai on this deal to try and onboard it…regardless if there is an allocated budget or not. For reference, here are the timeframes for the SPF: MIPs Portal For requests under 50k Dai, it’s at least a four week process for approval (RFC+Freeze+Vote). MIP55c3-SP7: Legal Work on MIP65 Special Purpose Fund was posted on Aug 16. We have just begun the 2 week RFC, another week of being frozen, then a week for a Governance Poll. @GovAlpha-Core-Unit please confirm. I see Sept 5 for the Start of the Governance Vote. On the G&R call today, you said it was going to a vote on Monday. That does not seem to be consistent with MIP55.

I hope the G&R call explained why it’s more than just a one time legal opinion. The onboarding process requires multiple domains, one being legal, to help with the collateral implementation through the exec and then during the collateral management phase. And…I’m open to any process to improve the flow of RWA deals. The more friction we apply to deals, the more concise we need to be on timing and setting expectations. Right now, there are many points where the community has an option to stop a collateral onboarding. The deeper the commitment from MakerDAO and the applicant, the more precise we need to be with communication and commitments. As we’ve seen, it’s about building trust.

SPF requests for 50K DAI or less are eligible to enter the Weekly Cycle once they have fulfilled their two-week Feedback Period and one-week Frozen Period, that can overlap with the Feedback Period. The Ratification Poll will go up on Monday, September 5th and run for three days.

monkey.irish:  it’s more than just a one time legal opinion   Yes, I follow. Thank you. I would be in favor of not specifying MIP65 in this request. Preference would be to give you and your team flexibility to use your best judgment on what resources can best be deployed and when in order to best move all the critical balls forward dynamically. I’m not in favor of singling out and prioritizing MIP65 for all the resources requested with this proposal.     monkey.irish:  My gut tells me the lump sum approach will bring up all sort of tangental discussions that I do not want to be involved with at this moment   You’ve made a clear case for what’s needed from a continuity and DAO operations perspective, and I am supportive! I think the all-in request entangles you less, which I also support!

ACREinvest:  I would be in favor of not specifying MIP65 in this request. Preference would be to give you and your team flexibility to use your best judgment on what resources can best be deployed and when in order to best move all the critical balls forward dynamically.   Thank you for your comments. After considering all the feedback, I am going to simplify this request and focus on the use of the current CES budget. While CES has a professional services line item in our budget, we didn’t anticipate spending it on professional services for RWAs. Given the current situation and to eliminate any confusion with the SPFs, I am asking the community to support the utilization of the current CES budget for RWA professional services. I have provided the updated details in the forum post. The community can decide if the SPFs, MIP55c3-SP6: Legal Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral (bIBTA) Special Purpose Fund and MIP55c3-SP7: Legal Work on MIP65 Special Purpose Fund, are still needed if this PFR is approved by MKR holders. @GovAlpha-Core-Unit @strat-fin-core-unit @juan @Nadia

Could I propose the below approach and settle this with no further confusion:  CES should be able to use its budget to provide engineerings and services to collaterals with no further permission / emergency power required, since there is urgency but no emergency + totally in scope SF to finish providing legal review on MIP65  If MIP65 SPF is approved, SF can be reimbursed and pay for salaries If MIP65 SPF is not approved, SF to request reimbursement from CES   SF to facilitate independent third-party domain work on bIBTA as agreed  If bIBTA SPF is approved, SF to fund in budget neutral way wrt overall DAO budget If bIBTA SPF is not approved, SF to request funding from CES   In parallel, CES leverages its bandwidth and budget to clear out other collateral applications from the backlog in parallel  Starting with Egyptian ADTC for eg There is no shortage of other greenlit applicants if not   Until RWF budget is resolved, CES funds and facilitates further legal domain work on RWA going forward  Does that make sense ? Edit removed a separate point about something else unrelated to MIP65 or bIBTA
Sounds interesting! I’m glad the community is working hard to try and find the best way forward.
Definitely makes sense to approve the initial budget for PFR and see where it goes from there

adcv:  In parallel, CES leverages its bandwidth and budget to clear out other collateral applications from the backlog in parallel   I agree with this in principle. Just wanted to add that @prankstr25 and New Silver have been awaiting review and input from Maker mandated actors since the community poll back in June. It’s a vault increase rather than something new, is generally well known collateral, and to top it off, a long-standing Maker partner. Would feel remiss not to mention this explicitly in the discussion of things that have been left outstanding.
